stem: Differentiate between left-sided and right-sided heart failure clinical cues.
template: The nurse identifies {{sign1}} as a classic sign of left-sided heart failure due to pulmonary congestion, while {{sign2}} is a indicative of right-sided heart failure causing systemic venous congestion.

rationale.correct: Left-sided = Lungs (Crackles, Dyspnea). Right-sided = Rest of Body (JVD, Edema, Ascites).
rationale.incorrect: Pink frothy sputum is a sign of acute pulmonary edema, a severe complication of Left-sided failure, but JVD is strictly Right-sided.
clinicalPearls: Most common cause of right-sided HF is left-sided HF.

questionTrap.trap: Left = Lung; Right = Rest of body.
